summary: The bill, titled the Enduring Justice for Victims of Trafficking Act, aims to amend U.S. Code Title 18 regarding assessments on convicted individuals. Specifically, it focuses on modifying Section 3014(a) to mandate courts assess an additional $5,000 on non-indigent persons or entities convicted of specific offenses, likely related to trafficking. The bill was introduced in the Senate on July 31, 2025, and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.
